text:
Hi Shana, hope you’re doing well! No problem, take your time and if you’re too exhausted it’s better to rest!  Yes, he’s very cinematic!  I guess before breaking the rules, warping, or flattening the image in a unrealistic way work well for children’s book but not often for cinematic, or at least not in a extreme way, and as my Art Director said once, before breaking the rules you have to know them! :) So of course for him perspective is very important especially on Backgrounds or production work. So after you try more ‘realistic’ and ‘correct’ images then will be natural and more efficient trying to simplify and starting to distort your shape and perspective. Eventually at this stage you could find ways that could build up your ‘style’. Another artist that work between Children’s book and Films is Pascal Campion. Also Goro Fujita. Check out also Annette Marnat and Amélie Fléchais.

Yes, for my children’s book I decided to keep perspective and cinematic images but I’d like to try more ‘illustrative’ and flat once.
For the book, I did the storyboard to study composition and to make story decisions, change details etc... and then I redraw every image in bigger pages for the final ones, bases on the storyboard.
Was my first time using pastels over watercolor so it definitely was scary and exciting! i wasn’t experienced with watercolors so the pencils on top gave me stability and uniformity
We can discuss about building a schedule that is not too overwhelming for sure!
Based on daily exercises that can help you inprove
Before this job I was working in Dublin, for a Transformers project (a kids tv show for Netflix, commissioned by Hasbro)
I wasn’t very happy with it so I went back to Italy and then moved here
Even if my contract is ending I’m planning to stay here
Some people are workaholic, they work all day. I rather prefer have more balance and try to do my work in the hour that are official for the studio (like 10am-6pm at Blue Zoo)
of course almost every day I do a bit more, maybe I start earlier or finish later
but overall If the deadlines are not imminent, this industry is quite cool and chill
If you want to create a schedule, like a tabloid or calendar we can discuss it and think what exercises you could realistically do during the day!
